theorem interior_closure_iterate_succ {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] (A : Set X) :
    ∀ n : ℕ,
      (Function.iterate (fun s : Set X => interior (closure s)) (n.succ)) A =
        interior (closure A) := by
  -- Define the auxiliary function `f := interior ∘ closure`.
  let f : Set X → Set X := fun s : Set X => interior (closure s)
  -- `f` is idempotent: `f (f s) = f s` for every set `s`.
  have h_idemp : ∀ s : Set X, f (f s) = f s := by
    intro s
    dsimp [f]
    simpa using Topology.interior_closure_idempotent (X := X) (A := s)
  -- For any natural number `k`, iterating `f` `k` times on the fixed point `f A`
  -- yields `f A` again.
  have iterate_fixed : ∀ k : ℕ, (Function.iterate f k) (f A) = f A := by
    intro k
    induction k with
    | zero =>
        simp [Function.iterate]
    | succ k ih =>
        simp [Function.iterate_succ, ih, h_idemp]
  -- We now prove the main statement by induction on `n`.
  intro n
  induction n with
  | zero =>
      -- One application of `f`.
      dsimp [f]
      simp [Function.iterate]
  | succ n ih =>
      have : (Function.iterate f (Nat.succ (Nat.succ n))) A =
          interior (closure A) := by
        -- Peel off the first application of `f`, then use `iterate_fixed`.
        simp [Function.iterate_succ, iterate_fixed, f]
      simpa [f] using this

theorem interior_closure_iterate_idempotent {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X]
    (A : Set X) :
    ∀ n : ℕ,
      Function.iterate (fun s : Set X => interior (closure s)) (Nat.succ n) A =
        interior (closure A) := by
  -- Define the function `f := interior ∘ closure`.
  let f : Set X → Set X := fun s => interior (closure s)
  -- Record that `f` is idempotent.
  have h_idemp : ∀ s : Set X, f (f s) = f s := by
    intro s
    simpa [f] using Topology.interior_closure_idempotent (X := X) (A := s)
  -- Helper lemma: for every `n` and every set `S`, iterating `f` `n.succ`
  -- times on `S` yields `f S`.
  have aux : ∀ n : ℕ, ∀ S : Set X, Function.iterate f (Nat.succ n) S = f S := by
    intro n
    induction n with
    | zero =>
        intro S
        simp [Function.iterate, f]
    | succ n ih =>
        intro S
        -- Unfold one iteration step and use the induction hypothesis together
        -- with idempotency of `f`.
        simp [Function.iterate, ih, h_idemp, f]
  -- Apply the helper lemma to the particular set `A`.
  intro n
  simpa [f] using aux n A

theorem closure_interior_iterate_succ_eq_closure_interior {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X]
    (A : Set X) (n : ℕ) :
    Function.iterate (fun s : Set X => closure (interior s)) (Nat.succ n) A =
      closure (interior A) := by
  induction n with
  | zero =>
      simp [Function.iterate]
  | succ n ih =>
      simp [Function.iterate, Topology.closure_interior_idempotent]

theorem interior_closure_eq_univ_implies_P3 {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X]
    {A : Set X} (h : interior (closure (A : Set X)) = Set.univ) :
    Topology.P3 (X := X) A := by
  dsimp [Topology.P3] at *
  intro x hx
  have : x ∈ (Set.univ : Set X) := by
    trivial
  simpa [h] using this
